title: Content Marketer Job at Pharmarun
content:
Pharmarun is an on-demand platform providing fast and easy access to medication. We do this by finding, financing and delivering medication to users.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Marketer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We’re looking for a creative and strategic Content Marketer to lead our content efforts across platforms.
	Successful candidate will own social media management, content planning, and creative execution (including graphics, videos, and copywriting) to grow our brand presence, engage customers, and support performance marketing goals.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute Pharmarun’s social media content calendar across Instagram, Twitter/X, LinkedIn, WhatsApp, TikTok, and Facebook.
	Write compelling content and copy for posts, campaigns, landing pages, email newsletters, blog articles, and product features.
	Create and edit short-form videos (Reels, TikToks, etc.), working with internal teams or freelancers as needed.
	Monitor content performance metrics, trends, and engagement to optimize reach and relevance.
	Collaborate with design, product, and customer service teams to ensure cohesive messaging and storytelling.
	Support campaign execution for seasonal moments (e.g. Detty December, World Health Days, IWD).
	Maintain brand voice and editorial consistency across all touchpoints.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree
	3+ years in content marketing, social media, or digital communications (experience in health, tech, or consumer brands is a plus).
	Strong copywriting and storytelling skills.
	Experience creating content across formats: static, carousel, video, email.
	Proficient with tools like Canva, CapCut, Adobe Suite, or similar.
	A strong grasp of platform trends, digital culture, and audience engagement strategies.
	Highly organized, self-motivated, and able to manage multiple content pipelines at once.
	Bonus: Basic understanding of paid ads or SEO.

title: Account Officer Job at  Ekiti Agro-Allied International Cargo Airport
content:
The Ekiti Agro-Allied International Cargo Airport is a new airport in Ekiti State, Nigeria, designed for both cargo and passenger flights. It received approval for non-scheduled flight operations in December 2024, with the aim of boosting the state's economy and facilitating the export of agricultural products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer

Job Location: Ekiti

Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Maintaining the billing system
	Generating invoices and account statements
	Performing account reconciliations with customers
	Daily reconciliation of revenue generated and remittance to the Bank as applicable
	Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Excel, ERP accounting software Skilled in regulatory tax filings.


Qualification / Job Specifications


	B.Sc. Accounting
	Minimum of 2 years of post-qualifications.
	ICAN, or ACCA, is an added advantage


Skills and Competence:


	Teamwork
	Time management
	Conflict resolution
	Good Leadership skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a certificate of Local Government of Origin to: jobs.airport@ekitistate.gov.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Only qualified candidates should apply.
	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Creative Manager Job at Brands Optimal Limited
content:
Brands Optimal Limited is a leading experiential marketing agency. We are one of Africa’s leading Experiential Marketing Agency which optimizes value for client through the use of strategic, reliable and measurable method in consumer engagement, loyalty seeding and sales generation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Creative Manager

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a talented and visionary Creative Manager to join our creative team and develop groundbreaking campaigns that captivate our audiences.
	The successful candidate should have a proven track record of delivering high-quality creative work, inspiring teams and collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders.


Job Responsibilities


	Ensure high-quality creative work that meets the brand’s standards and guidelines.
	Take jobs from concept to final execution and visualization.
	Brainstorm with team members to develop an aesthetic and original design that best reflects the big idea across all media. i.e., prints, websites, social media pages and other marketing materials.
	Work with the team members to understand project objectives and deliver high-quality visuals.
	Present completed ideas to both clients and sometimes team members.
	Stay up-to-date with industry trends, technologies and best practices.


Preferred Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Advertising, Marketing, Fine Arts or related fields.
	Possessing certification(s) in the creative field is an added advantage.
	The candidate must hold a 2:1 degree or higher.


Requirements:


	5+ years of experience in creative management, with a focus on event production, architecture, marketing or digital media.
	Cognise experience in the use of 3D software tools such as Blender, Premiere Pro, Maya, etc.
	Proven track record of delivering high-quality creative work.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and prioritize multiple projects.
	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
	Strong understanding of creative principles, including art direction, copywriting and design.
	Excellent communication, presentation, and leadership skills.
	ATL, BTL, and TTL backgrounds are desired.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their Resume and Portfolio to: jobs@brandsoptimal.com using the Job Position  as the subject of the mail.

title: Finance Operations Business Partner Job at Max Drive
content:
Max Drive - We are a team of passionate people and a leading technology-enabled company driven by a vision to solve the mobility challenges in Africa. We want to get people and goods to their destinations hitch-free. It is personal for us because we understand the frustration of epileptic transportation. We are making mobility safe, affordable, accessible, and sustainable through the deployment of high-performance technologies and operators.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Operations Business Partner

Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job type: Full time (On-site)
Category: Finance

About the Role
Business Partnering:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	To act as a key interface between Finance and the Growth and Expansion team.
	Develop and maintain accurate knowledge and understanding of the current growth and expansion requirements – locally and internationally. Provide key updates and follow up with the deliverables.
	Sign off and supply correct information for internal and external publication, for which accuracy and auditability are key.
	Operate a Finance onboarding process for new delivery partners to ensure that adequate data provision is in place and operational records are kept.


Planning, Budgeting & Forecasting:


	Agreement of cash flow forecasts and modelling assumptions with business owners, for submission to the Financial Lead for use in production of the monthly budget.
	Analyze the Budget Vs Actual for the prior month, check with the Finance lead and share with the Unit Leadership.
	Follow up with payment processing and approval for the unit and ensure proper upload unto the ERP.


Performance management:


	Review the unit’s Profit or Loss with finance and share with the unit’s Leadership for review.
	Provide advice and insight to the Financial Planning function in support of that function’s efforts to improve expansion and growth’s target.
	Understand the impact of variances on the unit’s financial position in its management accounts


Reporting:


	Production of regular management information for Finance, Senior Management Team and for other units as may be required.
	Production of ad hoc information and analysis on Growth and Expansion.


Requirements
Qualification and Experience:


	A graduate degree from a recognised university, postgraduate degree is an added advantage
	A minimum of 4 years of experience in accounting, finance, bookkeeping, and budgeting
	A chartered accountant with ACCA/ICAN or both
	Knowledge of ERP is compulsory; knowledge of Odoo ERP is desirable
	Experienced in financial interpretation and analysis
	Presentation skills
	Teachable, willingness to learn


Benefits
The MAX Work Environment:


	Drive: We are building a team where everyone is a leader and therefore runs on internal motivation
	Empathy: We have a clear understanding of the problem we are trying to solve and its impact on Africans; we are committed to providing a lasting solution.
	Humility: We are committed to continuous learning and improvement. We learn, unlearn, and relearn
	Initiative: We welcome novel ideas and encourage creativity
	Diligence: We take great pride in our work.
	Candor: We value open and honest communication
	Collaboration: We are a team of passionate, innovative optimists, solving challenging problems and creating an impact.
	Bias for Technology: We automate everything


What You’ll Get:


	Competitive pay & benefits
	Flexible work and hybrid working model
	Unrivaled Learning and Development
